title: Microscopic Alphabet
content:
Interesting read over at  
 [http://www.physorg.com/news93700449.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121041/http:/www.physorg.com/news93700449.html)

I dig the reference to a Times New Roman “font style”. Those serifs would be quite a feat, but I’d be more impressed if they tried [TheSansHair.](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121041/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/lucasfnt/thesanshair/sanshair.html)
author: koleslaw

comments.content:
OOOH

I want a tiny, nanoscale felt board to put them on to show the lunch special.

Or maybe a droplet of alphabet soup to feed my Luna moth.

I simply MUST have a vial of these things. I want to make Beorcana cocktails. “You’re drinking my typeface! BWAA HAAA HAAA HAAAAAA!!!”

Possibly more impressive is this microscopic detail executed in [hot metal](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121041/http:/cgi.ebay.com/Worlds-Smallest-Lords-Prayer-Metal-Type-Print-Set_W0QQitemZ320090314162QQcategoryZ109689QQrdZ1QQssPageNameZWD1VQQcmdZViewItem)

I was given a similar piece from Monotype at the Type Museum as a souvenir, much crisper finish though.

Tim
